Comment: It's interesting how he talks about loneliness and low self-esteem among the members of these groups. Not necessarily the leaders or true believers, but the followers, how they're fairly normal guys who seem to literally just want a reason to get out of the house and talk to people.  I don't know any right-wing extremists myself, but I feel like I've known the kinds of guys who could fall down that rabbithole in the right circumstances. It's like any other kind of manipulation, in a way. But I've also known the kinds of angry white guy who was like... he's a loser, he knows he's a loser, but he really wants to be able to lean on "white guy" to give him a boost in society, to give him some status he can't create for himself. What's that saying about how it doesn't matter how shitty your life is as long as you're still better than some other outgroup?  That seems to be behind a lot of racism, and also a lot of incel stuff. Being a guy women want to date, actually  treating a woman in a way that makes her enjoy being around you, feels impossible, so you yearn for the days when women had to marry any asshole who showed up. Her actual happiness is beside the point.
Author: 86throwthrowthrow1
